JobFullDesc: Microsoft Cloud Hardware Infrastructure Engineering (CHIE) is the team behind Microsoft’s expanding Cloud Infrastructure and responsible for powering Microsoft’s “Intelligent Cloud” mission. CHIE delivers the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's over 200 online businesses including Bing, MSN, Office 365, Xbox Live, Skype, OneDrive and the Microsoft Azure platform globally with our server and data center infrastructure, security and compliance, operations, globalization, and manageability solutions. Our focus is on smart growth, high efficiency, and delivering a trusted experience to customers and partners worldwide and we are looking for passionate, high energy engineers to help achieve that mission. As Microsoft's cloud business continues to grow the ability to deploy new offerings and HW infrastructure on time, in high volume with high quality and lowest cost is of paramount importance.  To achieve this goal, the Cloud Hardware Manufacturing Engineering (CHME) team is instrumental in defining and delivering operational measures of success for hardware manufacturing, improving the planning process, quality, delivery, scale and sustainability related to Microsoft cloud hardware. We are looking for seasoned engineers with a strong passion for customer focused solutions, insight and industry knowledge to envision and implement future technical solutions that will manage and optimize the Cloud infrastructure. We are looking for a Principal Quality Engineer to join the team.   #azurehwjobs   ResponsibilitiesBe the system quality technical leader who is working through design, validation, production, and supplier teams to find and fix problems that will potentially impact Microsoft’s cloud environment.Grow and mentor our diverse cloud hardware engineering resources with the use of best practices in supplier quality management, hardware development, and system qualification.Building a strong supplier quality management strategy to ensure the data center hardware are manufactured at highest level of quality standards. Lead quality issue or improvement task force to contain, mitigate and resolve the top-quality issues impacting global data centers.Collaborate with different teams (such as design, system engineers, suppliers) to setup server system level quality requirements. Drive Azure hardware quality improvements, through failure analysis, and root cause using a combination of Microsoft and supplier resources.Own and contribute to decision making processes involving hardware not meeting Microsoft requirements, leading the path to a predictable quality outcome.QualificationsRequired: BS degree in Materials Science, Electrical or Electronics Engineering OR equivalent experience.10+ years of direct engineering experience in system level hardware development problem solving and directing of FA resources. Deep knowledge of motherboard, platform, and server development, with strong knowledge of critical to function parameters and industry specifications for all subassemblies.3+ years directly responsible for assembly of cloud hardware, including server platform or ingredients. 5+ years in customer facing role accountable for the quality of Hardware and responsible for fixing the customer’s problems through remediation. Strong leadership skills and ability to work across the different organization with a call to action.Deep understanding of root cause/corrective action methods to identify contributing factors of production defects.Must have strong communication and project management skills. Preferred:  Master’s degree in Electronics is preferred.12+ years of working experience at Electrical industry or supplier quality for electronic component in Cloud server industry.Demonstrated effective in changing and organizations behavior.Ability to analyze large data sets, extract the essence, and present and communicate the results effectively.Familiar with datacenter environments, including infrastructure, networking, power distribution, and repair processes and procedures.Use and apply statistics to evaluate product reliability and highlight potential product risks.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
